channel.title: How to downgrade a server
channel.description: How do you downgrade, say, a 317 server to be compatible with the real 194 client?

item.title: How to downgrade a server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:7, topic:528303”][quote author=iz3 legend link=topic=647051.msg4351401#msg4351401 date=1376702603]

Go through the #194 client and compare it’s protocol to the one of your #317 server. You’ll have to do a bit of digging in the client and editing your servers protocol to match it. I’m not sure if there’s any documentation but a google search couldn’t hurt either. If there are already some existing real #194 servers those would be a great reference as well.

Thats the problem, there arent any REAL 194 servers. And also I am VERY unfamiliar with Client-Server interactions

Then familiarize yourself with those interactions. A big chunk of RuneScape emulation is knowing how the client and server play into each other. Also i believe there have been a few #194 servers over the years just none that where ever widely used.

But the client is obfuscated… and like IDK the like veins and arteries of RuneScape, if RuneScape was a human. But I know about its skin and appearance…

Then read into deobfuscation. If you don’t understand it, research it until you do.
[/quote]

I can deobfuscate but im too lazy… lol its a pain[/quote]
Stop being a lazy son of a bitch then and do something.

Read full topic

Then don’t ask for help here if your capable of solving your own problem but just to “lazy”. Not every aspect of development is fun, but you have to work around that to produce the finished result.

Read full topic
